metadata.title: CVE-2015-3282 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium
metadata.description:
vos in OpenAFS before 1.6.13, when updating VLDB entries, allows remoteattackers to obtain stack data by sniffing the network.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2015-3282` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libafsauthent1 - 1.6.7-1ubuntu1.1
libafsrpc1 - 1.6.7-1ubuntu1.1
libkopenafs1 - 1.6.7-1ubuntu1.1
libpam-openafs-kaserver - 1.6.7-1ubuntu1.1
openafs-client - 1.6.7-1ubuntu1.1
openafs-dbserver - 1.6.7-1ubuntu1.1
openafs-fileserver - 1.6.7-1ubuntu1.1
openafs-fuse - 1.6.7-1ubuntu1.1
openafs-kpasswd - 1.6.7-1ubuntu1.1
openafs-krb5 - 1.6.7-1ubuntu1.1
openafs-modules-dkms - 1.6.7-1ubuntu1.1
openafs-modules-source - 1.6.7-1ubuntu1.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: openafs package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1.6.7-1ubuntu1.1').
